>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

The Tuatha were descended from the same group as the Fir Bolg. The Fir Bolg were the 4th invasion and the Tuatha the 5th.
When the 3rd invasion, Nemeds, failed the Fir Bolg fled to Greece (Atlantis?) and became slaves before returning while the Tuatha fled to 4 cities in an unknown land to the north where they gained magical knowledge before returning.
Its possible that the Tuatha fled to some state that rivalled Atlantis or maybe to Atlantis itself. I'm not really aware of the mythology surrounding it but could it be that the Tuatha fled to Hyperborea? All I really know about Hyperborea is that it was some advanced civilization that apparently existed in the north.

An important thing to note is that the final invasion by the Milesians apparently came from Iberia. Genetic testing on ancient Irish bodies show that around 6000 years ago there was a large migration from Iberia to Ireland. The Milesians supposedly displaced the Tuatha so that would make the Tuatha at at least 6000-7000 years old and likely much older considering how far their society had degraded by that time.

From Encyclopedia of Spirits

>A Fifteenth-Century Spell to Receive a Visit at Night from a Succubus This spell derives from a fifteenth-century manuscript, which recommends that it be cast on Saturday or Tuesday evenings, before or after Agrat goes riding with her host. Have a separate, private room ready with clean, white sheets. The supplicant should wear clean, white clothing. Fumigate the room and the bed with aloes wood (agar; oud) saying: I adjure you, Agrat bat Mahalat, Queen Demon with the great, strong, and terrible Name, With the name of the Holy Angels and with the name of Bilar the heroic, King of Demons That you send me (Name) daughter of (Name), the beautiful maiden from among the maidens who follow you, Whose number is like the number of the days of the year And with the names of Metatron and Sandalphon. The end of the spell reads: “And the knowledgeable will understand.”

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Agrat bat Mahalat The Dancing Roof Demon; Mistress of Sorceresses Also known as: Igrat bat Mahalat; Ograt bat Mahalat; Agrath bat Mahalath Agrat bat Mahalat (Hebrew for “Agrat daughter of Mahalat”) is a queen of demons. She commands 180,000 malicious spirits (18 legions of 10,000 each). She also rides through the air in her big chariot leading smaller bands of angels of destruction. Lilith is her rival and competitor.

>According to a legend, Agrat came upon King David sleeping in the desert and coupled with him while he dreamed. She conceived and bore Ashmodai, King Solomon’s brother, rival, and alter ego. Agrat may be a fierce demon queen, but she is also a spirit of wisdom. She trains witches, procures succubi, and is believed to be the spirit who communicated magical secrets to Amemar, a fifth-century CE Jewish scholar. Agrat is allegedly more interested in human men than women, or at least they are the ones who are strongly cautioned against her. Men are traditionally advised not to be alone, sleep alone, or enter the water during the times of the week when Agrat is most powerful, lest they fall under her spell. Days: Agrat is at the peak of her power on Wednesday and Friday nights. At other times, Agrat inhabits places uninhabited by people (that’s where you’ll find her), but on those two nights she can go where she will and do as she likes. Once upon a time, Agrat was free to come and go as she pleased, wherever and whenever she wanted, but a compromise with Hanina ben Dosa, first-century Galilean rabbi, wonderworker, exorcist and general thorn-in-her-side restricted her powers. He agreed to halt his attempts to completely banish her, and she agreed to start keeping regular hours.

In horoscopic astrology, a Saturn return is an astrological transit that occurs when the planet Saturn returns to the same ecliptic longitude that it occupied at the moment of a person's birth. While the planet may not first reach the exact location until the person is 29 or 30 years old, the influence of the Saturn return is considered to start in the person's late twenties, notably the age of 27.

Psychologically, the first Saturn return is seen as the time of reaching full adulthood, and being faced, perhaps for the first time, with adult challenges and responsibilities.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: The phenomenon is described by Western astrologers as influencing a person's life development at roughly 29.5 year intervals,[citation needed] though the planetary influence may be felt for a few years before the exact conjunction, and variable orbits of the planets can also make the time period longer or shorter. These intervals or "returns" coincide with the approximate time it takes the planet Saturn to make one orbit around the sun, roughly 29.5 years. Western astrologers believe that, as Saturn "returns" to the degree in its orbit occupied at the time of birth, a person crosses over a major threshold and enters the next stage of life. With the first Saturn return, a person leaves youth behind and enters adulthood. With the second return, maturity. And with the third and usually final return, a person enters wise old age. These periods are estimated to occur at roughly the ages of 27–31, 56–60 and 84–90. A fourth return—for those who live to see the age of 114–118—is sufficiently rare that it is not given coverage in the astrological literature.

DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not true then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

>>33808167
Well, let's do some basic math flerfy. Taking the numbers from google, the moon exerts all of 3 newtons of gravitational pull on the earth.
A shit ton of mass, over a bigger amount of distance squared, throw in the GC.
That is all of 0.003 m/s acceleration towards the moon. No. You would not feel it.
Why do we get tides then? It's complicated, but basically it comes down to aggregate action on the water.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pwChk4S99i4
Jump to minute 4 if you want to skip the pre-amble, but long story short: the water at the poles is pushing down towards the earth. But it's also, ever so slightly, pushing towards the moon because the moon is pulling it.
Which is pushing into water molecules that is, likewise, being pulled towards the moon. It's an aggregate force and that's why lakes don't have much of a noticable tidal affect. (The great lakes experience all of 5 centimeters of tidal affect. Amazing, innit?)

Now, as for the moon being tidally locked with the earth: That's also true for mercury, which is locked towards the sun.
And I think quite a few of Jupiter's moons. The reason is very simple, the moon is *not* perfectly even with the mass distribution. As such, in the past it may not have been tidally locked, but its rotation has slowed to the point that it is now. Now you might ask: Where did the energy go? The answer is the rotational energy is lost due to internal friction on the moon.

Also fun fact, the moon in fact does have a (negligable) atmosphere. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atmosphere_of_the_Moon

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33813225
FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

>but we're talkin' about muh horizon
>MUH HORIZON IS TOO FAR AWAY!
No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

>>33807870
I really appreciate Beksinski's work. He was an "outsider artist" with no formal training. Outsider artists are fascinating to me. I have a feeling if he received formal instruction in painting they would have hampered his creativity to make him a "proper" artist. The man himself said something like "My style is the result of the deficiencies of my psyche." Also he didn't need to make any money off of his art either, he had a day job as an architect (which lends a lot towards his buildings and perspective IMO). Basically he was able to capitalize on his own vision for everything he made, that's why he's so distinctive.

I had the thought the other day that it was a shame he died relatively early in life (Polish problems). I wonder how his style would have evolved had he lived through the 2000s.

>>33797704
The Ascendant Ruler is the planet that rules the rising sign, in your case Saturn. It marks out an area of special interest for your life. In your case, your placement of special interest is depressing your ascendant ruler.
In astrology there is this thing called an aspect. There are various types of aspects. Co-presence is when two planets share a house, sextile is when they're within a range of three houses, square is when they're within a range of four houses, trine is a range of five and opposition is a range of seven. Any planets that are in houses right next to each other or six houses away, however, are in aversion. Aversion is when planets do not see and interact with each other. This is bad for your Saturn, because Saturn is in a house ruled by Mars but cannot connect with it to receive support. Although fsr in your chart the engine you're using is saying there's an opposition between Mars and Saturn instead of aversion, which seems like nonsense to me. Both in Placidus and Whole Sign, your planets should be six houses away.

That's the wrong way to think about the outer planets. Their influence isn't fainter, nor even "subtler" as a synonym of faint, but rather has been tricky to cartograph within an individual's psyche. The current descriptions out there regarding what exact influences Uranus and Neptune and also Pluto have upon one mind at the time of birth, even without delving into the energies of particular signs, are woefully insufficient to understanding them.

The murky sense we get is that Uranus represents somehow a "higher" part of the mind, in a layer above Mercury; while Neptune represents a "deeper" part of the mind, in a layer sub Mercury. That seems easy to grasp initially until you try to explicitly mentally map out the psyche and its whole physiology (so to speak). It takes on too much of a nebulous character that yields no specific information.

It is extremely easy to say, "Mercury represents the operation of the rational part of our minds." And go through the signs and write up accurate detailed descriptions of real life consequences. It's an area of research opportunity.

Honestly shit sucks. It's like being mentally wheelchair bound. You have a problem but it's basically invisible unless you tell someone else about it.

They literally don't care that none of their arguments stand up to scrutiny, because when you inevitably tear it down logically, that's just proof you are a fed or a disinfo agent etc. Another difference I have noticed is that many conspiracies emerge as what I would call an "incentive rumor." Basically, everyone can agree there is more than enough incentive for something like Epstein getting killed before he blabs. Lots of conspiracies emerge because people will start speculating about precisely who the incentive belongs to and why. However, flat earth has no other incentive than something totally ridiculous like "globe makers are taking your money!" as if someone would create the most sophisticated conspiracy in existence just to keep raking in those fivers for the wish.com plastic globes. There's no logical incentive for their to even be a conspiracy. Yet, to flat earthers, it's the most important conspiracy because it potentially yields the most significance in terms of attacking an established orthodoxy; the probability of it being accurate is completely immaterial to them. Flat earth is essentially a matter of faith, and that's why you can't ever successfully convince a flerfer they are stupid. They will embrace any feat of mental gymnastics to avoid an invalidating experience like a bunch of twitter NPCs.

>Feel free to suggest resources
Resources:
Books:
- Liber Lilith by Donald Tyberson
A Gnostic Grimoire and Novel
https://www.pdfdrive.com/liber-lilith-a-gnostic-grimoire-e185231845.html
- Embracing Lilith by Mark H Williams
No PDF available online, but it's worth the price of admission. Split into three sections, it covers accounts of working with the Goddess and her place in history, a fictional account of her origins written from her perspective, and a Grimoire.
- Lilith: Dark Feminine Archetype by Asenath Mason
https://pdfcoffee.com/lilith-dark-feminine-archetype-2-pdf-free.html
This one is a collection of writings by various peoples, with a brief but fairly thorough history at the beginning. Part grimoire, part reverence. Contains art and accounts by different people.

Videos:
Who is Lilith? Ancient Origins by Esoterica
https://youtu.be/n1EKccz4fS0
A fairly extensive history on her historical origins
The Untold Truth of Lilith by Grunge
https://youtu.be/01guwJbp_ug
A short video intended for a popular audience
Goes over her myth and general nature
Goddess Lilith - What she likes, how to contact
https://youtu.be/75bnMRPRiDk
A simple, short to the point video that rings true to my experiences.
My Experiences Workiing with Lilith
https://youtu.be/EHol9LrpWks
One woman's account of her experience

For me it's been partially the opposite. Since working with her recently, I've been confronted with bisexual urges, and I'm still unsure how to reconcile them. It hasn't gotten to the point of feeling attracted to women in person, but nonetheless, my spiritual experiences lately have me questioning my sexual orientation.

It's embarrassing to admit, but I used to find women somewhat repulsive. I've always admired those who exemplify masculine virtues, and often saw women as the opposite, taking advantage of men's strength like parasites, subconsciously seducing their will just to satisfy their own needs. And I felt deeply ashamed of my sexuality as I recognised that same neediness within myself.

Even so, I still had to deal with gender dysphoria somehow. I already sought help from others when I was 14, but even then I could only wait as I lost things that felt important to me. But when I was 17, perhaps in a lapse of judgement, I turned to the occult. It was just a prayer to attempt to form a pact, and not even directed towards anyone in particular. But since then, my life began to change drastically, and I found relief that I didn't even think was possible.

As the wish I'd once made reached a satisfactory conclusion, and Lilith offered to guide me towards a new purpose, I thanked her and began to show my appreciation for her more. I thought I accepted myself now that I'm finally at peace with my body, only to feel lost again as spiritual experiences confront me with all sorts of sides of myself that I don't know how to reconcile. I'd have been content to ignore them for the rest of my life, but now I'm unsure how I'm supposed to proceed anymore. And although I recall her offer to guide me, I'm reluctant as I fear I'll be forced to face even more.

That's what I get for being dishonest with myself; for being so easily seduced as my contradictions are exposed.

>>33737944
I always struggled to relate to transgender people. Dysphoria was primarily a physical thing for me that ceased after my surgery, so I find the focus on stereotypes asinine and childish.

Two years ago, my older brother asked me to strangle his neck as hard as I can. He was curious if his neck muscles are stronger than my arms. I refused as it made me uncomfortable.
A year later, I felt scared as I realised how weak I am physically. But when I told my fiancé that I wanted to try building abs to boost my confidence, he was against it; he said he dislikes muscles on women. I lost motivation, as I realised I can never be as strong as him anyway.

I dislike alcohol, but knowing I'm way too hard on myself, I drank half a glass of champagne yesterday, hoping it would loosen me up a bit. The results were as agonising as I expected. It was far too little for me to lose control, but it became slightly harder for me to suppress my unwanted emotions. As they raged inside of me, I snuck away from my family and isolated myself. I forced myself to remain silent and still, but the storm inside only worsened.

When I returned, my brother noticed I was tense. He said to let out my anger by hugging him as hard as I can. So I embraced him, as if trying to crush him.
In that moment, I felt glad I'm physically weak. "I don't have to hold back. I don't have be afraid I'll hurt others, if this is all I can do", I thought.
But then, he said repeatedly: "You're strong. Those hormones didn't affect you nearly as badly as I thought." He sounded so relieved.

My brother is the strongest man I know. If I can be strong in his eyes even without training after 7 years of having less testosterone than most women, then I shouldn't belittle myself.
So I've decided to start working out and learn martial arts. It doesn't matter if I won't be as strong as I'd have been as a man; transitioning gave me other things that are more important to me. Even so, I still want to become my best self.

I attempted physical transmutation a few years ago, as I was curious whether it might work. However, I discontinued my efforts after a few weeks, as it caused severe inflammation and pieces of dead skin falling off in a particular area. Not only was the pain becoming unbearable, but I realised what I was doing was highly dangerous, as it was becoming difficult to even urinate. After discontinuing my magick, which consisted of daily energy work in a deep trance, the symptoms subsided in just a day.

My conclusions are that it's far more efficient to change physical things by physical means, and spiritual things by spiritual means. Not only that, but it's dangerous to attempt to remove body parts with magick; it's no different from convincing those parts of your body to destroy themselves, with no guarantee of actually getting the results you want. In my experience, physical surgery is both safer and much less painful in comparison. However, based on other results I got such as a sudden spurt of breast growth, I do think it can be useful for healing.

You posted here a while ago and clarified that you're not interested in physically transitioning, nor in changing spiritually. Perhaps it could be useful for you to try to understand why you think you want to be a biological woman, and find (other) positive ways for you to fulfil the underlying needs.

>crisis of faith
I haven't even read LL, and I still feel like that sometimes. Earlier today, someone asked me to pray for him, and it took me a few minutes to gather my resolve to request Lilith's assistance. I managed to stay calm by recalling that I've never felt malice from her, and that she only helped me get what I wanted.

What I've realised lately is that what I fear isn't really her, but rather things within myself that I'm afraid of as I don't understand them, then project outwards onto her. And as those projections don't appear to be wrong, I come to fear her instead of myself. But then I see her expressing those things that I couldn't accept about myself in such positive ways instead, and I begin to realise it was my fears that caused those sides of me to come out in the wrong ways in the past. When it's coming from her in such a calm and dignified manner, she makes it look so natural, and I realise I can be like that too.

What I thought to be so monstrous and feared, turned out to be womanhood; in the most unapologetic sense, unfiltered by society's expectations. It's embarrassing to admit that I got those things mixed up, and it's honestly a lot to take in. But as I come to understand her, and myself, the fear fades away.
Of course, men nor women are inherently good or bad. But people can get so lost as they misunderstand each other, and themselves in turn. If they feel ashamed of things that are perfectly natural, it saddens my heart. It's useful to know what's socially acceptable, but people mustn't lose themselves.

I don't know if that relates at all to the fear in your own heart, but I feel like I understand it in a way. As people idealise others from their own limited perspective, they're in fact rejecting the parts they don't understand; then if those misunderstandings are revealed, that can be very shocking or even frightening.

posts.sub: What does it mean to dream about a skinwalker?
posts.com:
First, I should explain the dream. Ill skip over unnecessary details.

I was staying at some random house that I’ve never been in or seen before in real life. This house was in the middle of nowhere and was surrounded by trees in the back. Based on the type of trees I guess I was somewhere up north. I was sleeping upstairs which looked like an attic that was converted into a room. The bed was right next to a circular window that had no curtains. In the dream I was awoken by an odd shout. It was clearly someone calling for help but it sounded really animalistic. In between each call for help there would be a shriek that would resonate in my ears. This went on for what seemed like hours. I was not stupid enough to get out of bed or to look out the window. Nothing else happened but I have never felt fear like that from a dream before.

Does this have any significance? I’ve never had any contact with a skinwalker before but somehow I instinctively knew that the noises were caused by one. If anyone has any info thanks.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33811930
One probably came up to your window to watch you sleep, the brain picks up on their presence quite well. However, instead of waking up it was incorporated into your dream. If you think this is the case, ensure all blinds are closed and there is no angle by which it could observe you at night.

On the other hand, having a nightmare or two is entirely reasonable, and considering just how primordial our fear of them is, it's no unwarranted or unusual.

I've had a few dreams and an encounter, hell I'm pretty sure one of them likes to come by my window every once and a while. I'll wake up with an intense fear, elevated heart rate and a ringing in the ear, an overpowering urge tells me to not look through the window so I turned over away from it and cover my head such that no direct visual can be made by the thing so that it gets bored and leaves. I could just be imagining things, but I've learned in regards to them to not ignore your gut because only your gut will be honest with you about them.

They don't like to break into houses unless you leave shit unlocked or opened so you'll probably be fine. Just don't be stupid.

>>33812269
I will correct you here. You misunderstand the nature of these beings. They aren't shapeshifters, they aren't evil shamanic witches, they aren't cannibals driven to madness, these are all (common) themes used to describe them. You'll often find these themes as folklore: Skinwalker, Wendigo, Ghoul, Dragr, Banshee, Rake etc. etc.

These are all trying to describe the same very thing. For clarity I call them crawlers, it's unambiguous and carries the least baggage.

Anyways, we aren't talking about shapeshifters we are talking about a nocturnal (human?)noid species that has several physical traits indicating a possible subterranean origin.

These include the pale skin, light absorbing eyes, flexibility and it's skinny frame.

They seem to be quite capable of intelligence and are able to psychologically manipulate Human beings into dangerous positions. They seem to be ambush predators in this regard.

Often a cry will be heard: A baby, a woman in distress, perhaps even someone you know. Their talent for mimicry is unparalleled by any other living being.

They are most likely the fastest land animal in the world, and can keep up with cars (I know this by direct experiance).

Anyways, making direct eye contact is a horrible idea for you, the observer in particular. It's mentally scarring and depending on what kind of person you are, traumatic. It was almost impossible for me to even break eye contact with it and the fucker was a distance away and I was safe. Not locking eyes with it (if it's observing you through a window) has the benefit of preserving your mental health somewhat and if the damage thing can't really see you it'll probably get bored and leave. They do have a habit of watching people sleep for some reason, but weirdly avoid breaking and entering. I'd imagine encountering it out in the wilds and unprotected would be a different story.

>Dream itself:

Happenings Type:
Type A: Marks on your body,bruises,scratches
Type B: Knocking,cracking noises when going to sleep
Type C: Critters,Spiders,Worms etc. Found on your body
Type D: Puddle of Water in your Room
Type E: Moving objects, Objects falling over
Type F: Loud boom noices. Electrical discharges

Type. In order to give me the best occurence, i will now set it to types:
Type A: Dream happened during your normal sleep shedule
Type A1: Dream after your normal sleep shedule and going back to sleep and wake up again
Type B: Dream during a Nap
Type C: Nightmare only half or an hour into sleep (30-60 minutes)
Type D: Nightmare in the middle of the night (4+ hours)
Type E: Nightmare after normal sleep and you wake up in the morning with it. (6+ hours)
Type F: Double or Triple dream during the Night
Type G: Fever dream
Type Z: Dream lasts only 5-10 seconds. Very short.

Explanations:
Lucid= You are aware that it is a dream and you can act out yourself.
Vision= Super Clearly visible. It feels you are really there and its almost real.
Sleep Paralysis = Awake, but not able to move.

No real life names, use nicknames or Anon.

Please don´t use any memes and try to be nice.
Every person will be treated equally.

Be nice, stay classy and pray to Jesus and ask him for forgiveness. He is the only one and true way to everything you need to know about life.

I have this recurring dream where I find myself in my car and I'm driving it but I'm not in control, then I find myself parked in some highly enclosed space that I couldn't possibly maneuver out of. The kicker is that I'm always kind of half awake and often sitting up while it's happening and can see the room around me but it takes me a while to realise that I'm just seeing my bedroom at which point I snap out of it.

This particular run of dreams ended a few nights ago when I saw the outlines of a very sinister vulture-like creature staring at me. I was so spooked by this that I had to get up and turn the lights on to convince myself I wasn't really there, much to the annoyance of my gf.

This is not the first iteration of this kind of dream. They seem to recur periodically through my life since my early teens. The previous iteration, I would find myself in front of a train that's about to crash into me, but never quite does. Or, driving a car that's about to crash but never quite does. After a while I realise I'm already awake.

The earliest iteration which I can recall, is where I'm on a stage I'm front of a. crowd of people whose faces I can't make out. I'm begging them to let me sleep but they won't let me, I'm often deeply ashamed of my state of undress in these dreams. Like in all other iterations, my eyes are open and I can look around the room but it takes me a while to realise this, if that makes sense.

>Another night (was foggy then too), I left a friends house after a party, was about 3 AM. I had to drive about 40+ miles home along a normally very busy highway. I've already done so several times, but here you go.

Me and my friend drove to an isolated spot near a creek to do some drinking. We feel like we are being watched when we pull up and park. A few minutes later, all we are doing is watching behind us (parked backwards to the woodline) and I see a pale white form standing out from the darkness. It's skin was like dry old dusty leather with varicose veins that are blue. I freak the fuck out and tell my friend to drive away. As we drive away me and him see the damn thing run across the road. It was incredibly fast and I saw it just barely long enough to make out its form. It was tall, had skinny arms and legs and a unusually small but round head (compared to its body). We drive away a few miles and it fucking follows us down the road, it kept up with the car.

We park at a lit parking lot that had cameras over it. It pops up a few hundred feet in front of us near some bushes and an unlit road. We take some pictures but they are of a quite shit quality for a multitude of reasons. Picrel is the one picture we got that shows something, a pair of eyes.

After an hour we decide to drive to the center of town to a 24/7 gas station for water and human contact (it was 2AM at this point). We exit the parking lot but are stopped at a light before the main road. To my right is a Grove of trees. Friend says he saw something moving over there.

My eyes adjust and I see the upper portion of its head peaking from behind a tree. It was staring directly at me. It eyes seemed huge but it was in fact it's eye sockets which absorb almost all incoming light. I couldn't look away and after a minute of probably the most horrifying, traumatic experiance of my life, I tell my friend to drive away. The moment I could no linger sustain eye contact I broke down into tears for about 30 seconds.

Words cannot fully describe how terrifying and evil these things are, and I had the luxury of encountering it from the safety of a car!

grew up in canada, and we had a channel called YTV, I think it's still around. But anyway, there was this show back in the mid 90s, with these 3 puppets, I think they were white and they each had different colored hair that was made from sparkly tassels or something. Anyway, there was a red one which I think was the leader, a blue one and a green one. For some reason I think they were a "band" or something. Only thing I can remember is them kinda bouncing around on a puppet stage thingy, with their hair flying all around. Very hazy memories of them, I've tried finding the show over the last 2 decades but I cannot find anything relating to it.
So, onto the good stuff. Around 1994 to about 1997 at the old house I lived in as a young kid, I would have these nightmares every night of these three. I am 30 now and can still remember some of them vividly. These dreams always felt very real and I always dreaded going to bed every night because I knew they would come.
They always started off with me in bed waking up at some point in the middle of the night after my mom had gone to sleep. I had a night light on and always had my radio on with the oldies channel on, so old boomer music from the 50's and 60's would be playing. So, I would awake in my racecar bed, which was facing the bedroom door and the only light would be from my night light, so pretty dim. I could see the hallway, the white walls were always a sorta nighttime blue hue and then blackness at the end of the hallway where the bathroom was with the stairs to the main floor off to the left. I would always be awake for a few moments and then I would hear voices coming from down stairs, like whispering voices, like mischievous they were up to no good. They would be talking coming to get me. Then I would hear running up the stairs and the three "puppets" from the show would come running from around the corner of the stairs into the hallway into my room to get me. I would wake up every time. Cont.

I would wake up every time they were about to kill me. Here's the kicker, they looked absolutely nothing like the puppets from the show. They were always adult sized in height and medium builds, not too lanky or bulky. Their hair was always really long and poofy, almost like the hair styles you'd see on glam metal band members. They always had paper white skin and these paper white jump suits with stripes going across from their mid arms and chest. Their hair and stripes on their jump suits were were the same colors from the actual puppets on the show, so Red, Blue and Green. I remember the eyes on each of them were black with tiny white pupils that glowed and they had sinister grins with razor sharp teeth. They fucking horrifying! Legit getting shivers typing this out, remembering these thing's and the setting. I can still remember it like it were yesterday, the smell of my room, the droning sound of oldies music playing and these freaks making a mad dash up the stairs and into my room surrounding me in my racecar bed, getting ready to eat me with those sharp teeth.

I always hate these threads because I put a lot into what I write and no one replies but whatever.

Ill keep them short and sweet then. These are the ones that really stick out.

One dream turned nightmare has me running first person through a nice neighborhood on a windy spring day. However all of these houses were right next to each other, only divided by their fences with a bit of yard grass in between.
I turn around and look to see a tornado forming above me, I make a quick decision to break into someones home to seek shelter.
Inside it was scary quiet, as if it was me in a void. I hear the sound of someone snoring off in the distance. I close in and notice an elderly Chinese man dressed in an ornate, red Chinese robe. The kind a Kung-fu grandmaster would wear. He looked to be napping sitting down on his couch, the living room was surrounded by authentic martial arts weaponry and ancient artifacts. I hear something crunch under my foot and before I could realize what it was I hear a deafening scream coming from the old man. Think those baby plants from Harry Potter. It all happened so fast, but in a matter of one second he gets up from his couch draws a bladed chained looking weapon and everything turns to black. I assume I died before I even hit the ground.

Another was where I was a king of some ancient Sumerian style city-state, surrounded by absurdly tall guard walls. About the size of a 15 story building.
After I take a tour of my city and met with all of my subjects ( I could tell I was a beloved leader that was trusted and respected, though I could also tell that some of the elderly and mature people seemed uneasy about something else going on)
I finally demanded my royal guard, after their many efforts to divert my attention, that I wanted to see what was beyond those walls.
They finally conceded, and led me to one of the doors opening to a winding staircase.
I reach the top and am heart struck by what I see.
Surrounded on all sides, approximately 3 miles(5 kilometers) of desolate no mans land separated us and an extremely hellish mountain range that encompasses our city full circle. The mountains were covered in dark black ash cloud with intermittent thunder illuminating the silhouette of jagged peaks and red hot hell.
They seemed to close in. I couldn't quite tell, but it seemed as it was creeping closer and closer.
I finally realized then what the walls were for.
I looked at my one guard accompanying me.
He looked defeated, almost as if he wanted to cry. We said nothing, but understood. There was nothing that could be done. We were all going to perish.

part 1, i see a news broadcast talking about how blue aliens are planning on abducting people tonight
part 2, my mom and dad are sitting on the porch talking about the upcoming alien abduction, i eavesdrop on their conversation
part 3, i wake up in the middle of the night. i'm paranoid about aliens so i go to tell my dad that i can't sleep. i'm walking down the narrow hallway to my parents bedroom. their bedroom door swings open, and my grandma (who didn't live with us) is standing in the threshold holding a basket of laundry. i can basically only see her silhouette. i ask her what she's doing. she doesn't say anything, her eyes light up neon blue. she starts to pursue me down the hall. my mom emerges from the bedroom also with glowing blue eyes. they chase me, i try to run but they catch me easily. they shed their human disguises and reveal their true alien forms, they look like greys but they're a deep blue cor. they put something like a brown plastic shopping bag over my head and start dragging me. they drag me through my sisters bedroom where she's sleeping. they take me out of her window and we're beamed up to their ship. that's when i woke up.
other than that the only monster i can recall ever dreaming about is bigfoot

posts.com:
Back in the year 2012 I had an incredibly vivid nightmare about fighting machines.
I was somewhere I understood to be Northern California, near the coast. I was separated from my friends and family and fighting alongside a group of strangers. We had no uniforms, and there were women and unarmed people in our group. We looked like homeless people with guns.
Suddenly this huge, dark cloud of whirling flying machines comes over the horizon. It came up and over one of those big, steep hills like they have in San Francisco. Countless machines actually darkening the area with their shadows. They looked like the man hacks from Half Life 2.
There was so much fear and panic.
We started retreating inside this shitty looking building to hide. The windows were all boarded up and there were objects like mattresses and tables places against the walls and windows to make them thicker.
We understood somehow that the machines could see through walls and this was our crude effort to hide as deep inside the house as possible and avoid being seen. Walls bolstered by fucking mattresses and cardboard and whatever was there to sort of "muffle" their vision.
We put the women closest to center of the house and posted up with rifles behind over. I remember being aware of them coming by the windows and looking for us.
As the cloud of machines attacked, different parts of it split off and spread out down the alleyways and streets. It was like they all had one mind and each rotor thing was just a single digit of this gigantic organism. You could hear screaming off in the distance when they bore down on a particular house and discovered someone.
It wasn't until around 2020ish that I saw that Chinese footage of a drone swarms and recognized it from the dream.

when i lived in a somewhat rural area that was expanding with new developments over time I saw/heard/experienced a lot of weird shit. And other people have too. Since I don't live there anymore i'll dox myself for the sake of storytelling. place is called Cumberland Beach in Ontario, immediately across the lake from an Ojibwe reservation and was Ojibwe land a long time ago. I'll start with my stories then move on to one I heard from someone I know (story pertains to her childhood friend)

>be me about 4 years ago now
>like going /out/ because nothing else to do in tiny community, no car
>huge development in backyard, gated, in construction at the time. Built on farmland.
>cars lining surrounding streets because 3/4 of parking lot had to be not built due to uncovering of graves during excavation
>le indian burial ground
>parking lot was on the back wall of the development, over the fence from neighbors backyard
>on the other side of development was long wooded road, was about 2 miles long
>one side of road had woods belonging to gun club
>other side has patch of woods belonging to no one (was eventually bought by development)
>road leads to other patch of woods, wetlands, unsuitable for building so popular spot for hikers and such
>walking back from going hiking, is twilight
>walking down the long road with the woods
>footsteps double
>stop
>hear nothing
>start walking
>footsteps double again
>stop again
>hear loud panting right in my ear
>whip around
>nothing
>start speedwalking
>speedwalking doubles
>sprint
>hear panting, now more distant, until i'm ~100m from a house
>get back without incident

posts.com:
Had out-of-body experiences where I visited a large house with an old woman who lived alone. Each time I visited she knew I was there and spoke to me, and warned me about an evil demon in her basement. She would say she really did not like going down into her basement, because the evil thing was there trying to frighten her.

I visited the house without really meaning to, but I kept being "brought" there, I guess? The old woman was nice enough, but she really did seem afraid of her own basement. I decided I was going travel to the basement and face whatever was down there.

When I approached I could sense guttural noises like meat being chewed and growling, etc. At first, I wasn't sure what the thing was but I could tell that it was malevolent and wanted me to leave. I began getting closer and focusing more intently on it, which angered it. It took the form of a large gnarled beast with pale skin and sharp teeth gnashing at me; think a kind of pig-like humanoid with fangs and wrinkled skin. I was completely unafraid and I felt absolute certainty that I was much stronger than this thing that was so desperately trying to frighten me.

Finally the thing charged me with its mouth agape and I extended a "hand" toward it and drew it into my palm. Even though it wanted to bite me, the force of my palm was such that it could not move at all. I willed it into the ground beneath the earth and stomped above its head as the last of it sank down. There was a crack through which it's eyes could still see me and it looked up from it's new home and I could see it lost its monstrous form and was now just a man. I got the impression that this was the spirit of a wicked man who died, and was trying to stay behind by feeding off the fear of whoever it latched onto. I didn't allow it to pass on, since I couldn't be sure it would do so if I set it free, so now whenever I dream I see it's eyes filled with rage staring at me from below the earth. Never was able to find the house again.

>at the back end of a long dream, dont remember anything before this finale though

>then, a powerful sensation from my rear periphery
>time seems to slow down as my body goes into survival mode
>i am turning around to face the thing, completely alert, petrified
>i see it
>a human figure, the size of a child like me, comprised of solar fire
>an infernal child, so bright i can hardly look at it, blazing so hot that the universe ends where its form begins
>walking slowly towards me with complete intentional confidence, as if knowing that no matter what happens it will always get to me
>somehow slip out of my terrified trance to run for my father
>make it to where he and the soldiers are, still working feverishly on a strange machine
>they arent concerned with me, but are completely focused on trying to stop the inferno child with the device
>i know it is hopeless, the being cannot be stopped and it sees me through any barrier
>wake up in a sweating panic, spend hours reliving the dream over and over wondering what it means
>half expect to see the sunfire being to materialize in my bedroom

posts.com:
this thread is right up my alley right now, literally just last night i had a dream about "entities"

entities really are the best way to describe them. most of them seemed malicious, but not quite "evil" enough to be called demons in the abrahamic sense.

i was in some dark complex, being chased and attacked (hunted?) by these invisible beings, desperately trying to find an exit, or at least a hiding spot. i managed to find a corner to lay low and catch my breath, but was found by one such entity. although it was invisible, i could still feel its presence there, and it felt different from the others.

this one told me that it was not like the others, and that it would not hurt me. it offered me help getting to safety, and protection not just in that moment, but for the rest of my life. all i had to do was let it into my body, with the downside that at some point in my life, by random circumstance, my earlobes would end up getting sliced open or mutilated. i thought "man FUCK my earlobes, i want outta here!"

as it entered my body, i got a sense that this being in particular was incredibly ancient, older than any recorded religion. it guided me to a wall, which opened for me, revealing a wide, empty sky. the being told me to jump, and after hesitating for a moment, i trusted it to keep me safe, and did as it said. instead of falling, i glided through the air, eventually passing by mountains, and finally landing near civilisation.

i'm normally very skeptical and not very spiritual, but something about this dream just hit me differently. it could be just that this dream was my brain's way of telling me that i feel overwhelmed in life and without guidance or direction. or i could have just let some ancient amoral spirit posses my body, which does sound a bit less depressing.

This has actually happened to me multiple times in my life. Each time, it's a recurring dream, or at least one where I encounter the same evil being repeatedly.

First time was when I was ~5 or so. I would see a witch, like a traditional movie which with gnarled green/grey skin. She brought me to a temple and was going to eat me, and would cackle as I cried and begged to be released. I would be locked in a wooden cage and made to watch as she prepared the rest of the ingredients. I would always wake up before she killed me, but each time I returned she would stick me in cage.

Finally, after many dreams where this witch made me feel so helpless and afraid I decided that I had to try and do something. I deliberately returned to her, knowing that she would put me in cage. Only this time I didn't cry and beg. She turned her back to me, as usual and I *exploded* out of that wooden cage. She turned, wide-eyed, the evil laughter gone. I grabbed her legs and dumped her over into her own fire. I vaguely remember waking up immediately, and silently whispering "I did it..." before falling back to sleep.

Never dreamed of her again.

posts.com:
>What are some monsters/entities/strange things that have terrorized you in your nightmares?
Have a few recurring ones but the theme always seems to come back to "don't stay in the same place"
Grabblers: If you're in a dark room with a closet or bed at the same time or they come out and drag anyone nearby under/inside. Typically ending in death. The annoying thing with these faggots is that lights will shut themselves off and won't turn on.
Stalkers: Basically a slasher monster. They slowly walk towards me and kill anyone in the way. Pretty easy solution is to just run away and don't stop running away.
Octopus: Gigantic octopus that drags you into the ocean if you're near the shore. Just don't be near the ocean. Unfortunately sometimes the dream puts you on a small island. No real solution other than don't be in that situation.
Tsunami: Repeating tidal waves eventually floods the entire world. Similar avoidance rules as the octopus.
Haunted House: Some houses just really, really don't like me being in them. A very scary "feminine" ghost comes out, usually from the "top" floor if I don't leave. I usually get the vibes if it's applicable immediately on entry. Solution: just don't be there.
Hunters: Not really nightmares so much as strong monsters. They tear open portals, sometimes multiple of them come in at the same time. Then they just start slaughtering people. Sometimes I'm strong enough I don't have to run away and just fight them head on. The strange thing is they don't seem to target me specifically, like most nightmares.
Zombies: Usually a mall or airport "locks down" and turns into a hellscape. Eventually I got good at escape the lockdown. But then zombies started coming out of the lackdown. I don't really know why I run from the zombies, they don't really seem to do anything other than be inherently scary. Anyways, the solution is to just outrun the spread of the zombies.
There's more if anyone is interested.

Galileo's dispute with the pope was not over the shape of the Earth, which both sides believed to be a sphere, but over its place in the cosmos and the manner in which Galileo published his findings. The Catholic Church never made an authoritative claim that the Earth was flat, and the majority of the fathers of the Catholic Church from early times all believed and taught that the Earth was a globe, which is the official position of Catholicism today. You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

I often have what i would call dreams inbetween normal state and lucid. what i mean is that I'm in first person, kind of conscious, and my actions reflect what I would do/would like to do in that scenario. But at the same time I don't have control over the dream, I can't do things such as materialize whatever I want or manually change the setting, or rather I wouldn't know how to. When I have those I often wake up with an "active" brain, not sure how to say it better, unlike when i'm woke up by an alarm, for example, where i feel sloppy and tired.

>>33806643
>How do i know if it's lucid dreaming or not?
You recognize a "full blown lucid dream" by your mental clarity, not what you're able to do. In full lucid dreams you have the same kind of sharp thinking as in real life, able to fully self-reflect and process thoughts as in waking life. In what you call dreams ibetween it's more like you're a zombie with a vague notion that there are no consequences for your actions.

>>33807184
If you're religious, you might benefit from thinking lucid dreaming is some kind of magic phenomena, since it will make it feel more real. If you want to just DILD, do the boring basic shit like keeping a dream journal, reality checks, and MILD before bed.

Day 7, I did the Wave 1-5 for the first time and that's pretty much when I decided that AP is something, but not sure what. I dabbled with it off and on until Day 55, which is when I managed to AP. I went into a room that was locked that I didn't have the key to, so I know I was AP and not sleepwalking or something. I'm trying to do it again because I am planning on conducting some experiments with another observer or a hidden item to see if AP is located within my own mind or if it is legitimately an external, objective phenomenon. Big if true.

But yeah, it's "real." I just don't know what it is exactly. I still roll my eyes at shit like reality shifting, demons, succubus GF, LoA, but honestly, if I was wrong about AP, I can't really say for sure what is or isn't real. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
as far as astral projection being “real”itself, it is and it isn’t. the real world is what we’d call the fake one right now
at lower levels of skill you move around your local space with poor to mediocre control. sometimes you get attacked by demons looking to scare you (it’s like food for them). once you get skillful at moving around local environments and keeping your brain waves there, we start calling it “remote viewing”
eventually you’ll get better at navigating the vagueness, but the better that you get at causes your soul to involuntarily move around different planes of existence. many of which are temporary and only created by your own mind. things get less vague, but you can have less control over where you’re going. things become more representative of ultimate reality, so you see symbols for other things instead of this little 3d realm that we have
lucid dreaming, astral projection, remote viewing are all the same thing. sober reality is like ice, remote viewing is like water, lucid dreaming is like steam. but they’re all astral projection. if you understand the analogy that should help you a lot

Most people are never truly tested, and I think part of the reason why we no longer teach each other to seek out these spiritual tests is it turns out you can actually fail them. Permanently.

If you truly in your soul desire to be a good and just person who walks in the light, you'll be saved, right? Well what if you don't truly desire to be good and just?
What would you do if faced with oblivion, knowing that you had long since strayed from a path you didn't believe in?

I believe most people, even the rich, desire to be good and spread love and all that. There are some, however, who desire only to wallow in spiritual excrement. They have learned how to feed on others and it makes them feel whole.

The choice came to me, once. I had been made to believe that there was no good in the world, and all other humans were evil. I had been tricked into thinking that I was the last person still holding on to hope; a misguided ape hurtling through a dead universe. I believed that all was lost and there was nothing for me but the knowledge that I had been abandoned by the entire universe. In that moment, I was tested. My resolve held, and I decided that even if I was the last and only person trying to be good, I would still not give in. In the absolute bottom of the pit of despair, my hope could not be crushed.

As soon as I made that choice and cried out saying that I wouldn't be swayed no matter what, it was like a signal to everything which side I had chosen. That was the most difficult thing I have ever done and to say it was an ordeal is putting it lightly.

While I eventually found my way out of that... pit, the thought occurred to me that not everyone would be able to make that choice. I was willing to be alone for eternity before I would follow an evil being. For certain, some would not find the same resolve that I had. Especially if they're tested before they've matured.

posts.com: Forgive me for what is surely basic levels of skepticism here, but - is there any actual proof of the occult? I ask because I’ve studied theology and the occult on my own time for years, and one of the most consistent things that irritates me about these topics, especially magic and the occult, is that people speak of and write about these things as if they’re undeniably real. I am at least passively willing to believe in these things, but I guess I just have my doubts. Yet there are so many individuals who believe in potent magics using angels, demons, talismans, and everything else. I just don’t get where their conviction comes from (yes, faith, of course, I just mean where does their actual epistemological belief come from?) I’d like to lean even more into the occult but sometimes I wonder if this entire branch of human interest is all lies, or even partial roots of truth surrounded by a forest of misunderstanding. Sometimes I wonder if it wouldn’t be better to just lean into science and the material world (though I’m not much of a STEM guy - certainly not a math guy lol)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
You currently live in a causal universe. The scientific method requires this to function, variables need to exist to cause outcomes. Physical cause and effect. Unfortunately magic can not be real if assessed in this manner. In your current state of mind, there's no proof that would be substantial for you.

You could just try a spell, and watch the world bend. But it could just be a coincidence and a schizophrenic delusion. Also, you think it requires belief (it actually doesn't).

So instead think. How did the universe start? All answers lead to an uncaused cause. An event that defies causality. Whether that's god, the big bang, or the original universe which built our simulation. This event is outside the scope of the scientific method. Which means acausal events are possible.

Usually, if people ask I just say, "No, magick isn't real". But that's because "real" is ill-defined.

Both were on patrol at 1:45 am, when they heard a noise similar to radio interference which later became an acute whistle. When it ceased five minutes later, they spotted an intense bright light in the sky, that lasted 15 seconds. Another guard arrived with a guard dog and all began searching around the area. The arms were very long and had no apparent hands or feet. Trejo fainted; after which his colleagues opened fire at the creature. 40 to 50 bullets were fired, but the being simply disappeared. While Trejo was being assisted, the same sound as before was heard. The next morning, 50 men searched the whole area but found no bullet casings or bullet holes. >Since you have experience with this, can you tell me what awaits me at the end of this path?
It's a way of life that in many people instills a kind of discipline and gives them purpose. Islam doesn't allow drinking alcohol. Islam doesn't allow premarital sex. It also makes you focus on what food you eat. Things like that can be very good for some people. It's a way of life, so there really is no "end" to it. The religion teaches that you build up good deeds through your daily salat or prayer. You also do this by giving, which is called Zakat. That is to say giving money to support Islamic causes. Or support poor Muslims. There's also the discipline of fasting on the month of Ramadan, which is when the Quran was revealed to Muhammad. Muslims also tend to say things like "alaihi salaam" when mentioning a prophet and "Sallahu alaihi wa sallam" when mentioning Muhammad. Also "Subhan wa Ta'ala" when they mention Allah. Those Arabic phrases help emphesize the special nature of the prophets, Muhammad as the Seal of the Prophets, and Allah as the Praised and Exalted One.
>What was your experience with the Torah in general?
It was very interesting to study it, even though my teacher turned out to be a cult leader of sorts. I still read the Torah and what I learned has still helped me in my life. It has been expanded with other knowledge though.
>What was your aim and what did you get from it?
I got some insights into the nature of the divine and was able to transfer those into occult and magic contexts. It really is hard for people to understand, but the Bible is full of magic.
>I did the Salat 5 times a day for a full week now, and it gave me some insights into the nature of the islamic framework
Yeah, that's pretty much the heart of Islamic practice. The other part of it would be Zikr/Dhikr or Remembrance of Allah. That is like the Buddhists doing Nianfo/Nenbutsu. Sufi has a rich tradition of Zikr. You can find good examples of it on Youtube.

First of all, do as you want to.

Second, why organized religion at all?

What keeps you from using the insights of Islam, and by extension of any religion, for your development, without converting?

In my experience, religion has the same relationship to spirituality as McDonalds has to nutrition.

While an authentic spiritual path for me is one of direct experience.

Also, Judaism led to Christianity led to Islam… each building one the one that came before.

I subscribe to the idea that ‘if God exists and wants to guide people without taking their free-will… he would reveal that what is important at that time in regards to the people and the time they are in.

Therefore, we are probably already in the unfolding of the next big thing…

Hope this helped.

They're also flexible, in that you can mix whatever process you want with them, like visualization of the end goal, or even just writing down what you want (preferably in past tense of having accomplished/received it).

Do you know about the Purification Psalms? They're a set of 7 Psalms - 6, 32, 38, 51, 102, 130, and 143. You use them for when you have big problems in your life, and feel overwhelmed. Traditionally, you go through one of them a day, until you do the whole set, and you can rinse and repeat each week. The key is being consistent with them daily.

>>33804448
Psalms as in the Psalms in the Bible (look up any of them from Psalm 1 to Psalm 150). You don't need an actual book, you can read online, and whichever translation doesn't matter (I like KJV for the Psalm magic process since it's more poetic, but I also use NIV to study them as a hobby). Process is:
1) Pick any Psalm (if you pick Psalm 119, it counts as a bunch of Psalms,
2) Have a desire to fulfill, or a problem to fix
3) Read the Psalm out loud once without stopping
4) Read the Psalm again slowly, verse by verse. You can do this silently in your head. Try to decipher the hidden meanings within them, as to how they pertain to your mind, or your situation. For example, "enemies" would represent "negative thoughts".
5) Repeat this process daily until you problem's fixed, or until you get a definite feeling that the Psalm worked. If you've ever experienced "inspired action", that's what this feels like.

If you go to the OP's Library, there's a Psalms folder. You can read the two booklets there, and the booklet authors have Youtube channels about this too. The other, longer book about the Psalms has the "traditional" uses of each Psalm, which can get you faster results as opposed to just using any Psalm (but any Psalm can ultimately be used for any purpose).

Video examples of the process (you can skip the "talisman" segment, the guy just augments his practice with talismans):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eR5GsKtI5A4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qfW2WhOSrMo

Bros I'm so lost. I feel like the better I get with meditation and spiritual practice in general, the more shit gets piled on my plate. Three years ago when I started working on myself, my life wasn't great but it was more of a comedy of errors and silly things that wouldn't quite work out.

As time has gone on, much of this has moved from comedy to tragedy with deaths and life changing events. And while it seems like I'm steadily becoming better equipped to deal with it, both in manifesting better outcomes and mitigating emotional effects through loving kindness, in the moments where hardships come as one thing after another, I wonder what it is that I must be doing wrong.

It makes me think of the bible verse, "He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much; and he who is dishonest in a very little is dishonest also in much."

In all this time, my life as measured by any human standard has only gotten worse while I believed my spiritual life to be increasing. The only thing I can think is that I am being dishonest, dishonest in little at the start and now in major areas of life as I've delved deeper. That what I believed to be progress was nothing but a strong delusion as surely if I were that much more developed spiritually, it should have some outward showing on the physical realm beyond getting a free hot dog, making a cut heal a little faster than normal, or having a baby stop crying in a supermarket.

Every time that I've felt like I'm at the cusp of achieving something huge in life, I ended up with countless different negative experiences all compounding on each other to the point that I lose my inner peace and retreat back to the "comfort" of my poverty mindset and abusive acquaintances, at which point all the major problems disappear and I'm left with my steadily degrading life and nothing more than the ability to feel good in my imagination.

What can I do?

posts.name: Anonymous

>>33811848
I don't need you to tell me specifics if you don't want to, but without knowing specifics of whatever "successes" or "failures" you have, it's too vague to give specific advice or comments.

However, I think you can sort things out yourself. One practice I suggest is following these posts about working with the Psalms
>>33804496
>>33804347

You can see from this anon >>33804573 that even with someone new to the process, he achieved great results.

The other thing I want you to do is to start being very clear about your problems, goals, and whether you're making progress. That is to say, actually write down, specifically, what you want to manifest. A list of sorts. Keep a running list of 6 things each day that you want accomplished or dealt with (optionally, it can be 3 things you want to gain, and 3 problems you want to remove from your life). Whenever you complete one of your goals, bless it instead of crossing it off (maybe use a symbol like a star or a smiley face or whatever, something more positive than just a checkmark). If anything's not done, put it on the next day's list, and move it up to prioritize it.

This will give you a very objective look at your capabilities. If you're on the right track, you'll end up with a bunch of blessings to be thankful for, that you can point to with confidence like "yeah, I did that!", and build positive momentum in your practice. On the flip side, if you notice things that aren't getting done, then you'll at least have clear direction on what to work on with yourself.

Anyways, that's what I recommend. Just be diligent with daily practice with both of those tasks, and I'm sure your life will change around.

posts.com:
>>33811017
The reason why I refuse to take existentialism as just another French fashion or historical curiosity is that I think it has something very important to offer us for the new century. I'm afraid we're losing the real virtues of living life passionately, sense of taking responsibility for who you are, the ability to make something of yourself and feeling good about life. Existentialism is often discussed as if it's a philosophy of despair. But I think the truth is just the opposite. Sartre once interviewed said he never really felt a day of despair in his life. But one thing that comes out from reading these guys is not a sense of anguish about life so much as a real kind of exuberance of feeling on top of it. It's like your life is yours to create. I've read the postmodernists with some interest, even admiration. But when I read them, I always have this awful nagging feeling that something absolutely essential is getting left out. The more that you talk about a person as a social construction or as a confluence of forces or as fragmented or marginalized, what you do is you open up a whole new world of excuses. And when Sartre talks about responsibility, he's not talking about something abstract. He's not talking about the kind of self or soul that theologians would argue about. It's something very concrete. It's you and me talking. Making decisions. Doing things and taking the consequences. It might be true that there are six billion people in the world and counting. Nevertheless, what you do makes a difference. It makes a difference, first of all, in material terms. Makes a difference to other people and it sets an example. In short, I think the message here is that we should never simply write ourselves off and see ourselves as the victim of various forces. It's always our decision who we are.

The new evolution stems from information, and it stems from two types of information: digital and analog. The digital is artificial intelligence. The analog results from molecular biology, the cloning of the organism. And you knit the two together with neurobiology. Before on the old evolutionary paradigm, one would die and the other would grow and dominate. But under the new paradigm, they would exist as a mutually supportive, noncompetitive grouping. Okay, independent from the external.

And what is interesting here is that evolution now becomes an individually centered process, emanating from the needs and desires of the individual, and not an external process, a passive process where the individual is just at the whim of the collective. So, you produce a neo-human, okay, with a new individuality and a new consciousness. But that's only the beginning of the evolutionary cycle because as the next cycle proceeds, the input is now this new intelligence. As intelligence piles on intelligence, as ability piles on ability, the speed changes. Until what? Until we reach a crescendo in a way could be imagined as an enormous instantaneous fulfillment of human? human and neo-human potential. It could be something totally different. "I will go on a great journey.", he says aloud to himself.
He then goes through the small village telling anyone that will listen; "I'm going on a great journey."
He made procession through the village and everyone gave their best wishes.
The man was beginning to feel emboldened and boisterous.
He came with a crowd of onlookers as he reached the end of the village.
He saw a young child.
The little boy said, "I will go on a great journey someday." and the man nodded, the crowd cheered.
He waved back joyfully at the people as he set on his journey, ready for anything.
He came up on many farms and as he was walking by a stable a horse said, "Hey."
Our intrepid hero stopped and looked at bemusement of a talking horse. "What's that?", he said.
"The road is dangerous, there have been earthquakes. You're liable to run into some deep holes."
The man, admonished by the talking horse, replied, "I think I'll be alright. I'm on a great journey."
And he went forward a little bit and was lost to sight forever.
Then a man bent up from behind the horse.
"I tried to warn him."

>Year was roughly 2015 iirc
>Be me
>In 8th grade, second semester about to leave for high school
>History teacher has an end of year project for us to do in groups.
>History teacher was a plump, cool old woman who was very passionate about history and always friendly. She was a few years from retirement
>She unveils the project to be a "fun" and "easy" group presentation
>The presentation was going to be on conspiracy theories
Fuck the greentext, this story doesn't really work with it. Anyway she pulled up a slide for our groups to pick conspiracy theories from. We were supposed to argue for or against the theory (already pretty based idea for a teacher, really shows this woman was cool). However when she pulled up the slide, it had some strange ass theories on it. Some were easy, low hanging fruit. "Elvis is still alive" was what my group chose. All the other kids also chose the light hearted ones like that (such as Area 51)

But there were other options. I swear on my life that I remember seeing the JFK assassination, 9/11, Bohemian Grove and the fucking SANDY HOOK SCHOOL SHOOTING on there. I am not making this up. They were listed on the board for the whole class. Nobody said a word iirc

Oh, absolutely. A lot of people today awaken kundalini unintentionally, either spontaneously or as a result of a extreme emotional or trauma response. Now, releasing kundalini energy is kind of like peeling one petal of an infinite and immortal flower - when people without energetic awareness do this, they may not necessarily feel it, so they think "oh huh, that didn't work, let's try again". So they do it ten more times, and then spend ten years in a psychiatric hospital because they're flooded their system with way more energy than it could reasonably handle, manage and use up, like flooding an electrical appliance with ten times the electricity it needs - it won't work "faster" or "better", it'll just break down. Kundalini awakening is about purging, optimising and only gradually flowing stronger energy through your energy system. Kundalini will give you more than plenty for this purpose even without manually releasing petal after petal. Doing that would be like blowing up a dam and standing in the way of the rushing water.

>>33779600
Some further advice I can give. First, I would recommend that you look through the Traditionalist school authors. They are very reliable people and if you understand their works you will have a frame of reference to distinguish sound knowledge on these subjects from bad info. Evola is also included, particularly his spiritual books, even though the wikipedia editors have excluded him for some reason. Not all of the stuff you see on kundalini will be the best, because there was nothing like the flow of information back then that we have now. The principles are perennial, however, and will help guide you.
Second, about energy. The terminology is kind of ambiguous and can have slightly different connotations, but generally, energy, chi and prana are loosely equivalent. For a breakdown on energy (specifically chi), you can check out Damo Mitchell's Intro to Daoist Nei Gong. He has a section on this that you may find useful. I think that's a book I can probably mention on /x/ with clear conscience.
As to the difference between energy-as-such and kundalini energy in particular, it comes down to this: the energetic level is a kind of subtler level of the physical (or the physical is a denser level of the energetic if you prefer). This energetic level is kind of superimposed on top of your body and you rely on it for a lot of your normal functioning. This applies to all people. Kundalini energy is a special energy - it is the transcendent force, and it has a purpose and a goal which, once awakened, it pursues without pause, even if you suddenly have second thoughts. This transcendent force aims to help you overcome your conditioned existence, purge your energy system (which involves a lot of emotional/trauma releasing since those are stored as energy, and it also involves kriyas), and finally, when the process is complete and it fully develops your 7th chakra, you receive a strong connection to the divine, and enlightenment.

The human needs to do certain movements and gestures that signal to the body to integrate with the self. The techniques for doing this were not discovered, but rather they were taught to ancient peoples as a way to attain balance and resonate with holiness.

The practice of Kundalini, as it exists today, is a remnant of this a kind of Kemetic yoga. All yoga is descended from the original exercises taught to humans, but too much of the data has been lost for any being to actually attain full unity through the movements alone. Kundalini is the purest form that can still be learned, and therefore the most potent and dangerous as well. It can grant you an awakening to the energy within your own body; awareness and control of different systems that the conscious self thought to be cut off from.

I have heard that practitioners can begin to see spirits and... other subtle things more easily. I don't know much more than that but the teaching are usually coupled with dire warnings, which is probably why the pure movements died out to begin with. Why do the dangerous stuff when you can do more basic things that carry no risk?

I would say don't engage in Kundalini until you have a wise teacher who can protect you.
